message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of person re-identification in video surveillance, which is a computer vision problem, hence it is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) category. The paper also deals with the problem of cross-modal matching between images and descriptions, which involves natural language processing, making it likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) category. The paper proposes a novel model for this task, which involves multiple granularities and end-to-end training, making it likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. The paper also involves matching visual human parts with noun phrases, which is related to multimedia analysis, making it likely to belong to the cs.MM (Multimedia) category. Finally, the paper involves similarity evaluation, which is related to information retrieval, making it likely to belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) category.
